item.title: Kubernetes: Touning resources
item.description:
Ok, andiamo dritti. Hai cambiato i values, i pod vecchi sono stati killati e i nuovi non partono. Facciamo troubleshooting in 6 check veloci. Copia‚Äìincolla e leggiamo i messaggi chiave.

  1. Stato rollout (capire cosa manca)

kubectl rollout status deploy/prov-ippv2-pr-platform-ippv2-emailsender -n prov-ippv2-pr-platform-namespace kubectl get deploy/prov-ippv2-pr-platform-ippv2-emailsender -n prov-ippv2-pr-platform-namespace -o wide

Requests = what the scheduler needs to place a pod

cpu_request: 200m memory_request: 512Mi

Limits

memory_limit: 2048Mi # keep this to avoid OOM

item.title: Docker vs cose
item.description:
VIRTUAL MACHINE VS DOCKER

virtualization and VM are virtualizing hardware

while Docker virtualize OS operating system

docker is a crazy microcomputer and gonna replace VM

because Docker containers are so lightweight and fast!

STEP 5 - DOCKER

you need to learn Docker RIGHT NOW!! // Docker Containers 101

  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eGz9DS-aIeY

Docker vs. Kubernetes: The ONLY Video You Need to Finally Understand Containers!

  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oGPjzCBZGzg
  • DOCKER = is used to package application in container.
  • Docker alone is useful for
    • single container apps
    • and local development environments
    • docker simplify building and testing apps
    • but if you want to manage, deploy and scale many applications? docker alone fall short. ‚Üí KUBERNETES is essential
    • kubernetes ensure apps run reliably at scale

item.title: Kubernetes: <titolo>
item.description:
Kubernetes

Cluster

  • Cluster = l‚Äôintero datacenter Kubernetes
  • Cos‚Äô√® il cluster EKS: composto da Control plane + Worker nodes

Control plane: API server, scheduler, controller manager, etcd. In EKS √® gestito da AWS. Non c‚Äô√® un tuo ‚Äúmaster node‚Äù su EC2.

Worker nodes: le istanze dove girano i Pod. Sono EC2 (providerID AWS), pronte, v1.33.4-eks-‚Ä¶

  • Comando utile: kubectl get nodes -o wide

Namespace

  • Namespace = ‚Äústanze‚Äù dentro quel datacenter. Pi√π namespace convivono nello stesso cluster.

L‚Äôisolamento √® solo logico: per isolare rete serve NetworkPolicy.

item.description:
LINUX

Bash Scripting Tutorial for Beginners

what is shall? what is bash?

  • CLI => a way to interapt with computer by writing commands

  • in Linux CLI is SHELL

  • BASH => Bourn-Again Shell (most common shell) is not only a shell but it’s a programming language

  • bash scripts

  • grep -c “ERR” application.log

item.title: Networking: <titolo>
item.description:
NETWORKING

what is an IP Address? // You SUCK at Subnetting // EP 1 THE ENTIRE PLAYLIST: [ ] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5WfiTHiU4x8&list=PLIhvC56v63IKrRHh3gvZZBAGvsvOhwrRF

  • ip address like a phone number to identify devices. 192.168.1.204 MR. SUBNET MASK aka NETMASK Tells what ip addresses start with. he tells the street we live on..
  • subnet aka netmask 255.255.255.0

MR. DEFAULT GATEWAY aka ROUTER He does it all. give ip addresses to our devices in our network and could help us to get outside our network. if you wanna visit netflix for instance.

item.title: Nginx: <titolo>
item.description:
NGINX

‚ÄúReverse-proxy to an app on localhost‚Äù NGINX riceve le richieste e le inoltra a un‚Äôapp che gira sulla stessa macchina, di solito su 127.0.0.1:PORT. Cos√¨:

l‚Äôapp non espone porte pubbliche

TLS, compressione, rate limit li fa NGINX

puoi fare routing e bilanciamento

NGINX Explained - What is Nginx [x] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iInUBOVeBCc&t=484s

  • NGINX = piece of software on a server that handles HTTP requests.
  • NGINX once when internet was easy was only a high performance webserver but now with millions of http requests can also act as a load balancer: distributes incoming traffic acrosso multiple backend servers (with others nginx)
  • PROXY = Acting on behalf of another, proxy server: intermediaty servers that forwards client requests to other servers with the fewest active connections.
  • NGINX configurations‚Ä¶.
  • NGINX in KUBERNETES: nginx as K8S Ingress Controller‚Üí essentially a proxy , specialized load balancer for managing ingress (incoming) traffic in kubernetes.
  • perch√© se gi√† i cloud platform come AWS hanno i loro load balancer, dovremmo usare nginx? perch√© lavorano insieme.
    • NGINX ingress controller act as load balancer inside the k8s cluster. Not public accessibile.
    • while the cloud load balancer (AWS ELB) is accessibile from public.
    • super security! so the cluster is never directly exposed to public access

item.title: Webserver: <titolo>
item.description:
WEB SERVER

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9J1nJOivdyw

just a piece of software that serves web content.

  • listen on a port
  • for a request
  • transport protocol
  • response containing the resource
  • resource

üîπ 1. Ogni frontend ha bisogno di un web server

Il browser non legge ‚Äúfile dal disco‚Äù, ha bisogno di qualcuno che glieli dia via HTTP.

Quel qualcuno √® un web server: Nginx, Apache, Caddy, S3+CloudFront‚Ä¶ o anche un serverino Node come serve.

üîπ 2. Angular, React, Vue in dev mode
